author: @banksofnoon7867
text: One thing that he didnt touch on is that Business Analyst has a wide range of field. From health care, to marketing to real estate to production and operations (which I am working as a BA now) to finance. It depends on the company and your specific background. No company would want an analyst with IT background to handle their financial document. If anyone wants to become a BA, pick your specific interest.

text: You can include a Business Intelligence Analyst as a more specialized medium between a Business Analyst and a Data Analyst. author: @rcruzthomas
text: In title, I've been both Data and Business Analyst. As a Business Analyst, I was expected to also have the skillset of a Data Analyst to be able to analyze our business and tell the story. The project manager portion for me has been working with our internal IT team, and/or external contractors, to troubleshoot and resolve any data issues in the reports that you are using. I would say project manager ability in that respect is also a Data Analyst responsibility, in my own experience.
